title: How to Make Stuffed Capsicums or Bell Peppers

steps.headline: Prepare your stuffing in a large bowl.
steps.description: For this recipe, you'll need to combine the following ingredients: 1 cup uncooked rice, 1 can pureed tomatoes, 1 tbsp. dried paprika, 1 chopped onion, and 2 tbsp. chopped basil. Stir them together until they're completely combined.

steps.headline: Prepare your capsicums or bell peppers for stuffing.
steps.description: Wash the peppers and then carefully slice off the top and remove the seeds from the inside, until the inside is nice and empty. Using a spoon to remove the seeds is ideal, though you can also use your hands. Be careful to keep the rest of the pepper intact. Though the typical way to stuff the peppers is through the top, if you want to go against the grain, you can also cut them lengthwise and stuff both halves.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F(150°C).
steps.description: Give your oven a few minutes to fully heat up.

steps.headline: Stuff your peppers and place them inside a casserole dish.
steps.description: Fill peppers with the stuffing and if you cut them in the second style, you can add the lids back on. You should be able to stuff each pepper with about 1/2 cup to 1 cup of the stuffing mixture. Use a spoon to do this for best results. When you're done stuffing the peppers, you can place the tops back on.

steps.headline: Add 2 cups of bouillon to the casserole dish.
steps.description: You can also just add water instead.

steps.headline: Bake for an hour.
steps.description: Bake these peppers for an hour or a little bit longer or less time, depending on when the rice and peppers are tender. Move the peppers around occasionally while you're cooking them with a large spoon so they cook evenly. Baste them with the water or bouillon in the dish so they stay moist and flavourful and so that the filling does not dry out. 1 hour is suitable for thick fleshed peppers. If your capsicum has thinner flesh, then adjust the time to suit as the flesh of the pepper will be too soft.

steps.headline: Remove them from the oven.
steps.description: Let the peppers cool off for at least 5 minutes before you dig in to them.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Enjoy these tasty peppers while they're nice and hot. You can serve them with more vegetables, rice, and pasta, or you can enjoy them on their own. Use the remaining broth in the casserole dish as a serving sauce to make the capsicums or peppers even more flavorful.

steps.headline: Wash and prepare 4-5 capsicums or bell peppers.
steps.description: Green or red work for this recipe. After you wash the peppers, cut off the tops and carefully gut the peppers to remove any of the seeds on the inside. You can use a spoon or your hands. Just be careful not to cut into the sides of the pepper since you'll need it to stay strong.

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients for the stuffing in a bowl.
steps.description: Place the following ingredients in a large bowl: 1 ½ cups cooked black beans, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, ¾ cup salsa, ½ cup corn, 1 cup cooked brown rice, 1 tsp. chili powder, 1 tsp. cumin, and 1/2 lb. ground beef. Stir the ingredients together until you've combined them pretty evenly.

steps.headline: Stuff the peppers with the mixture.
steps.description: Just use a spoon to place the stuffing in each pepper. Leave some room at the top for the ingredients to expand a bit. You don't want to over-stuff those peppers or they might explode.

steps.headline: Place the peppers in a crock pot.
steps.description: Put the stuffed peppers in the pot with the tops facing up so that they are just touching each other.

steps.headline: Pour ¼ cup of water into the bottom of the crock.
Cover the crock and cook the peppers for 3-4 hours.
steps.description: This can take a bit less time or a bit longer depending on how long it takes for the peppers to get tender.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Sprinkle the peppers with 1/2 cup of chopped chives and serve them with sour cream for an extra kick.

steps.headline: Know that each pepper will hold 1/2 to 1 cups of stuffing.
steps.description: A large capsicum or bell pepper will be able to hold about 1/2 to 1 cup of stuffing, so plan your recipes accordingly. The recipes below are meant for 4-5 bell peppers, so be prepared to make some adjustments.

steps.headline: Make a cream-cheesed based stuffing.
steps.description: Just combine 1 cup of cream cheese, 1/4 cup of sour cream, 1 cup grated cheese, 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley, dried chili flakes, dried cumin seeds, and dried paprika to taste (about 1 tsp of each). Then add 1 tablespoon of sugar. This recipe is also highly recommended for sweet paprika peppers. If you choose the cream cheese filler recipe, it is better to heat the oven to 200°C/400°F and roast them in a lightly oiled pan without water until the peppers flesh is tender - about 20 minutes. Then top with any surplus cheese filling to serve.

steps.headline: Make a pasta-based stuffing.
steps.description: Use a cup of pasta sauce and mix it in with one cup of water. Then, get 2 cups of dried pasta, which can be anything from penne to gnocchi, and combine it with 1/4 cup of grated cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste for this recipe.

steps.headline: Make a pesto-based stuffing.
steps.description: For this one, all you need is 1 cup of herb and pine nut pesto, 2 cups of ricotta cheese, 1 egg, and 1/2 cup of grated cheese. Mix all the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste. Your peppers will be all ready to stuff.

steps.headline: Add meat to any recipe.
steps.description: Take about 300 grams of any minced meat and gently brown it in a pan with 1/2 a cup of white onions. You can add this meat to any of the recipes to make them more meat-friendly.

steps.headline: Finished.
